            By 
Burgess Everett

11/17/15 02:12 PM EST
House and Senate Republicans are planning another joint retreat for early next year.
The gathering is slated to be held in Baltimore on Jan. 13 and 14. Sen. John Thune of South Dakota, the No. 3 Senate Republican, made the announcement at the Senate Republican lunch on Tuesday, according to a source. 
Story Continued Below
For the first time in decades, the two caucuses held a joint retreat last January in Hershey, Pa. But with lingering coordination issues and new Speaker Paul Ryan, republicans figure a do-over couldn't hurt.
 © 2015 POLITICO LLC
title: GOP plans joint retreat early next year
